title: Cheryl dares to bare in plunging gold mini-dress on Attitude Awards red carpet
text:

Cheryl stepped on in a daring ensemble as she rocked the red carpet for the Attitude Awards held at the Camden Roundhouse on Wednesday evening.

The mother-of-one, 35, paraded her assets in a mini-dress embellished with gold sequins that exposed her chest with a cut-out detail across the bust.

The Promise This hitmaker ensured she looked every inch the vixen by wrapping a thick velvet choker that featured a large buckle around her neck and strutted along in over-the-knee boots.

Protecting her legs from the October chill, Cheryl slipped her pins into sheer tights that could be seen below the super-short hemline of her dress.

Cheryl complimented her ensemble by wowing with metallic make-up.

(Image: Getty Images)

The former L’Oréal brand ambassador styled her brunette locks down in loose curls and appeared happy to pose for pictures.

The former girlfriend of Liam Payne's appearance comes after she said she would rather her music did "awfully" than put out tunes that compromise her taste.

She opened up about her regrets about not pushing for certain singles to be put out in her old Girls Aloud days.

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

"Sometimes decisions were made to keep the labels happy as opposed us as artists and it's hard to put your full heart behind decisions which aren't your own," she told Fault magazine.

"Of course, I was young and there's no telling if what I wanted would have been for the best commercially but at the time, they felt more like the right ones for me but I didn't push enough for them.

"I'm just happy that now my knowledge and my confidence has grown and I'm able to make the important informed decisions about my work. I'd rather have my music do awfully and hold the blame myself than do anything my heart isn't truly in."

But despite saying she would quit making new music if her last single flopped , Cheryl now vows never to give up.

(Image: Getty)

"Music is my love and it's my passion and there's always going to be things that I need to say so it's so hard to think about that time for me," she went on.

"I do sometimes sit back and imagine my life when I'm older and grey but I love it right now.

She concluded: "It's funny, the music industry keeps changing and after my break it felt like starting again because everything about the process was different and I had to learn a new industry which was very different to the one I knew before."
description: The former Girls Aloud singer slipped on a racy ensemble for her appearance on the red carpet
